intro: Artanthe microstachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed artanthe, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small, daisy-like blooms that typically appear in late spring to early summer. Artanthe microstachya is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas.
